content.question: The reaction in which <math alttext="H 2 O liquid " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is decomposed into <math alttext="H 2 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 2 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is thermodynamically unfavorable (<math alttext="delta G naught is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>). However, an electrolytic cell, such as the one represented above, can be used to make the reaction occur. Which of the following identifies a flaw in the representation?

choices.label: Oxidation is occurring at the anode instead of at the cathode.
The equation for the reaction is not correctly balanced.
Electrical energy is needed for the reaction to proceed.
The relative volumes of collected gas shown in each tube are incorrect.

content.answer: The equation for the reaction is not correctly balanced.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
